column4: fyi, under normal screen usage it's -r to reconnect, the -x if for multi-display

in order to use names to reconnect (you need to name them first, ctrl+a then shift+a) for example one of my screen sessions (listed with "screen -ls" is 3302.monitors, and i can use "screen -r monitors" to reconnect to it)
I was under the impression that screens would name themselves based on the PID and the name of the process? At least, they usually do for me
